summary: An FBI email from August 8, 2019, sent by a Supervisory Special Agent (SSA) of Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) in New York, requesting additional manpower for a planned search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island in St. Thomas, scheduled for August 11-14, 2019.

persons.name: SSA Squad C-20
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent, FBI New York
persons.context: The author of the email, requesting additional manpower for a search operation on Epstein's island in St. Thomas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose private island in St. Thomas is the target of the planned FBI search operation.

connections.description: The FBI agent is organizing a search of Epstein's private property as part of an investigation.

events.title: Planned FBI search of Epstein's island
events.description: The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad planned to execute a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's private island in St. Thomas.

keyFacts: The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in New York was actively planning a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island in St. Thomas in August 2019.
The search operation was scheduled for August 11-14, 2019, indicating ongoing investigative activity shortly before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The email demonstrates direct FBI involvement and planning for physical evidence collection at a key Epstein property.
The timing of the planned search (days after Epstein's arrest) shows the rapid escalation of the investigation into his assets and operations.
